data.title: Drop Dead! Will Leave Audiences In Stitches
data.meta_description: Tickets are on sale now for the Bucyrus Little Theatre production of Drop Dead! | Community Theatre | Purchase Tickets
data.text:
Tickets On Sale For March Performances

When a cast of “has-been” actors and a “washed up” director attempt to revive their careers by staging a mediocre play on a shoe-string budget, murder ensues. The cast of Drop Dead! will take the Bucyrus Little Theatre stage March 8-10 and March 15-17, 2024.

Directed by Jason Chandler, Drop Dead! is a full-length comedic murder mystery that features local actors Tim Lutz, Matthew (Lee) Sterling, Joseph Loftis, Dodi Conkel, Billie Weiland, Randy Mann, Karellyn Sterling, Graham Leonard, Curtis Ashley, and Abbey Kanellakis. The show, written by Billy Van Zandt and Jane Milmore, is presented by arrangement with Concord Theatricals on behalf of Samuel French, Inc. Please note that this show contains mature language and themes. Parental discretion is advised.

“This show has it all,” said Chandler. “There are so many really funny moments that will have you doubling over in laughter. Each actor in this cast has really gone above and beyond. It’s not easy to play a character who is playing another character - but they nail it. It’s very well executed.”

Tickets are $15 for adults and $10 for students. However, parental discretion is advised as the show contains mature language and themes. Friday and Saturday performances begin at 7:30 p.m. while Sunday performances start at 2:30 p.m. More information about the show and to purchase tickets, visit www.BucyrusLittleTheatre.com. Additionally, the box office will be open for advance ticket sales 6-8 p.m. Monday, March 4, and Monday, March 11. Tickets will also be available at the door on a first come, first served basis.

Call the Bucyrus Little Theatre at 419.562.0731 with questions about the performance, special accommodations, or for assistance pertaining to your online ticket purchase.

About Bucyrus Little Theatre

Founded in 1951, the Bucyrus Little Theatre exists to provide cultural enrichment, education, and entertainment to Bucyrus and the surrounding communities. Located at 130 Songer Avenue in Bucyrus, Bucyrus Little Theatre presents four regular season performances and a range of other activities for community members. To learn more about Bucyrus Little Theatre, including upcoming performances, audition opportunities and how to get involved, visit https://www.bucyruslittletheatre.com.
